page.title: 13GRANGE FARM VISIT.
page.content: ONE WET TUESDAY WE VISITED A FARM. SHELTERING IN THE SHED WE ASKED OUR QUESTIONS. THEN WE SAW A THIRTY YEAR OLD FERGUSON {TRACTOR}. WE COMPARED IT WITH THE NEWEST JOHN DEERE, COMPLETE WITH PADDED SEATS AND RADIO. FARMER JOHN GROWS WHEAT, BARLEY, SUGAR BEET, POTATOES AND OATS. SCARECROWS ARE {SCARCE}, BUT A GAS GUN (WORKING ON A TIME SWITCH) FRIGHTENS THE BIRDS AWAY. THE PIG UNIT HAD ONE{ BOAR}, SEVERAL SOWS AND SIXTY-SIX PIGLETS. GARETH WONDERED WHETHER THIS COULD BE CALLED {BIGAMY!} THERE WERE PENS OF PORKERS BEING FATTENED FOR MARKET. THEY WERE TO BE KEPT FOR TWENTY WEEKS AND THEN SENT TO THE BUTCHERS OR CURED FOR HAM. THE FARMER MADE USE OF HIS DEGREE FROM CAMBRIDGE UNIVERSITY; A GOOD EDUCATION WAS USEFUL. THE FARMER ENJOYED HIS WORK,ESPECIALLY GATHERING IN THE {HARVEST}.
